page.title: 10 THE ELFORDLEIGH HOTEL
page.content: The Elfordleigh Hotel is set in about twenty hectares of parkland.It was built around 1710 the exact date is unknown.It was first built as a private house for a man called Doige. Some tiled fire places,dated by the ceramic tiles,were built about 1740. It was turned into a hotel by Admiral Bainbridge and it was called Devon Greswolde Hotel and then to the Elfordleigh in the 1940's. Only thirty five guests can stay at once but it costs a lot.There are about twenty staff including gardeners and the manager and his family. There are over five hundred club members that come to play golf,tennis or squash,or to swim in the private pool. The grounds are beautifully kept. There are many varieties foreign plants that the admiral collected.
